page.title: 11BRAFFORDS PIG FARM.
page.content: The owner keeps two thousand pigs. They are large white Landrace pigs. They are supplied at about nine to ten weeks old. They stay at Brafford's Hall for nearly fourteen weeks. At twenty four weeks they weigh about one hundred kilos and they are fattened for bacon. The pigs are fed on a highly concentrated mixture of waste ( fish, pastry potatoes, biscuits ,sweets, jelly babies etc.) from factories. The pigs are kept in a controlled environment which draws out stale air and puts in fresh air. The pigs are not slaughtered at Brafford's Hall. Instead they are sent to a public slaughter house, where they are beheaded. Looking after them is a full time job.
